column1: NGR is from 1950s record and assumes New and Old gauges were located in the same place; there is nothing to suggest otherwise. Stated altitude seems about 10 to 20 ft low. 1888 record is for Eunant as opposed to Eunant Bridge and has a lower altitude of 785 ft and is probably about 200 yards in the submerged village of Eunant; the lake was filled in 1888/1889.
Jan 1941 readings estimsted for snow but left in this record
Old and New gauge overlap for 50 months and 2 readings are duplicated; probably coincidental.
